metadata.title: CVE-2021-33135 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
Uncontrolled resource consumption in the Linux kernel drivers for Intel(R)SGX may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable denial of servicevia local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-25-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-5.15.0-25-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-25-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-25-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1004-kvm - 5.15.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1004-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1003-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1003-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-gke - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1001-gkeop - 5.15.0-1001.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-24-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-24-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1003-oem - 5.17.0-1003.3
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1004-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.0.0-1006-oem - 6.0.0-1006.6
No subscription required
